entry.title: Janet Sorg Stoltzfus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that American educator Janet Sorg Stoltzfus (pictured) established the first foreign school in northern Yemen?

entry.title: Kurama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the character Kurama was inspired by a friend of manga creator Yoshihiro Togashi?

entry.title: an organism from which all current life on Earth is descended (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there was an organism from which all current life on Earth is descended?

entry.title: Ernest Fanelli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ernest Fanelli's composition Thèbes, written in 1886, utilizes musical elements considered to precurse Impressionism?

entry.title: 2022 LA Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Washington State linebacker Daiyan Henley opted out of playing in the 2022 LA Bowl and served as an assistant linebackers coach during the game instead?

entry.title: Arifin Achmad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while Arifin Achmad was the third governor of Riau, he was the first to hail from the province?

entry.title: a supreme headquarters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Central Powers brought their armies under a supreme headquarters in September 1916, 18 months before the Allies did the same?

entry.title: Love or Loved (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that, when discussing his music project Love or Loved, K-pop star B.I said that he felt the opposite of love was not "I don't like you", but rather "I loved you before"?
